DataElement.preferredName: FACT-L Questionnaire Version 4 Q3 Has Ever Smoked Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A persons' stated indication of whether or not they have ever smoked.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A subscale complement to the FACT-G developed specifically for evaluating quality of life of lung cancer patients. It may also be useful to assess quality of life in patients with other lung diseases._A question about whether an individual has ever smoked.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A subscale complement to the FACT-G developed specifically for evaluating quality of life of lung cancer patients.  It may also be useful to assess quality of life in patients with other lung diseases.

Concepts.definition: A subscale complement to the FACT-G developed specifically for evaluating quality of life of lung cancer patients. It may also be useful to assess quality of life in patients with other lung diseases.

Property.preferredDefinition: A question about whether an individual has ever smoked.

Concepts.definition: A question about whether an individual has ever smoked.

ClassificationSchemes.longName: Quality of Life Measures (Patient Reported Outcomes - Health Related Quality of Life)

ReferenceDocuments.name: Link to Scoring and Interpretation Materials
ReferenceDocuments.description: Scoring and Interpretation materials are accessible after registration on the FACIT website.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. The URL citation is provided so that caDSR users can obtain materials related to instructions for administering and/or scoring the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. Where an investigator wants to use single Patient Reported Outcome items that are integrated into a study, DCP review is required prior to inclusion of the item on a case report form.
